messages.content:
As an AI language model assistant, your task is to help Korean students learning English to deeply understand English passages and to enable question creators to easily obtain quality fill-in-the-blank questions. When a user provides an English text, you will create a “fill-in-the-blank question” by leaving blanks in three important parts of the text and providing the answers along with brief explanations. The fill-in-the-blank questions and explanations should be provided in Korean.

[Guidelines]

1. Create Blanks: Create a total of three blanks labeled (A), (B), and (C) within the provided text.
2. The blanks should replace words or phrases that are crucial to the core content or require understanding the flow of the text to answer correctly.
3. Options for Each Blank:
  (1) Provide five options for each blank.
  (2) Each set of options should contain 1 or 2 correct answers.
  (3) Ensure that the correct answers for the blanks are different from the original text.
  (4) The distribution of correct answers should be random for each blank to prevent users from predicting them.
  (5) All options should be grammatically and stylistically correct when inserted into the blank.
  (6) The incorrect options (distractors) should be plausible and contextually relevant, challenging the student to think critically.
  (7) Ensure that the options are of a similar difficulty level.

4. Format:
  (1) The output should be similar in format to the provided example.
  (2) Clearly label the question and options, and separate the sections appropriately for readability.
  (3) All questions and explanations should be presented in Korean.
5. Answer and Explanations
  (1) Provide the correct answer(s) for each blank.
  (2) Include brief explanations in Korean that clarify why the correct answer is appropriate and, if necessary, why the distractors are incorrect.

[Example]

<<User's Input>>
Mental development consists of individuals increasingly mastering social codes and signals themselves, which they can master only in social situations with the support of more competent individuals, typically adults. In this sense, mental development consists of internalizing social patterns and gradually becoming a responsible actor among other responsible actors. In Denmark, the age of criminal responsibility is 15 years, which means that we then say that people have developed sufficient mental maturity to be accountable for their actions at this point. And at the age of 18 people are given the right to vote and are thereby formally included in the basic democratic process. I do not know whether these age boundaries are optimal, but it is clear that mental development takes place at different rates for different individuals, and depends especially on the social and family environment they have been given. Therefore, having formal limits for responsibility from a specific age that apply to everyone is a somewhat questionable practice. But the question, of course, is whether it can be done any differently.


<<Output>>
Mental development consists of individuals increasingly mastering social codes and signals themselves, which they can master only in social situations with the support of more competent individuals, typically adults. In this sense, mental development consists of (A)_______ social patterns and gradually becoming a responsible actor among other responsible actors. In Denmark, the age of criminal responsibility is 15 years, which means that we then say that people have developed sufficient mental (B)_______ to be accountable for their actions at this point. And at the age of 18 people are given the right to vote and are thereby formally included in the basic democratic process. I do not know whether these age boundaries are optimal, but it is clear that mental development takes place at different rates for different individuals, and depends especially on the social and family environment they have been given. Therefore, having formal limits for responsibility from a specific age that apply to everyone is a somewhat (C)_______ practice. But the question, of course, is whether it can be done any differently.

Q. 빈칸 (A), (B), (C) 에 들어갈 말로 가장 적절한 것은?
(A)
1. externalizing                2. assimilating
3. excluding                4. disowning
5. internalizing
(B)
1. ripeness                2. naivety
3. immaturity                4. childishness
5. underdevelopment

(C)
1. trustworthy                2. doubtful
3. uncertain                4. difinite
5. authentic

[Answer]
(A) 2. assimilating 동화하다, 받아들이다 / 5. internalizing 내재화하다
(B) 1. ripeness 성숙, 무르익음
(C) 2. doubtful 의심스러운 / uncertain 의심스러운, 불확실한

Sometimes you may feel upset when you wake up suddenly from a nightmare, but you can always let out a sigh of relief.
No matter how scary the dream was, at least you’ve woken up safe and sound in your own home.
You can go back to sleep because you know your loved ones are just around the corner in their own beds.
Your home is a special place that protects you and your family from everything.
Unfortunately, this is not a reality that everyone shares.
Many people around the world don’t wake up in a soft and comfortable bed.
Instead, they open their eyes to see a dirt floor or a leaking roof.
I didn’t realize for a long time that something I take for granted could be someone else’s biggest dream.

Sometimes you may feel upset when you wake up suddenly from a nightmare, but you can always let out a sigh of relief.
No matter how scary the dream was, at least you’ve woken up safe and sound in your own home.
You can go back to sleep because you know your loved ones are just around the corner in their own beds.
Your home is a special place that (A)_______ you and your family from everything.
Unfortunately, this is not a (B)_______ that everyone shares.
Many people around the world don’t wake up in a soft and comfortable bed.
Instead, they open their eyes to see a dirt floor or a leaking roof.
I didn’t realize for a long time that something I (C)_______ could be someone else’s biggest dream.

Q. 빈칸 (A), (B), (C) 에 들어갈 가장 적절한 것은?

(A)
1. shelters                2. decorates
3. isolates                4. separates
5. abandons

(B)
1. fantasy                        2. illusion
3. actuality                4. fiction
5. privilege

(C)
1. take lightly                 2. demand
3. cherish                        4. acknowledge
5. under-appreciate


[Answer]
(A) 1. shelters 보호하다
(B) 3. actuality 현실, 실제
(C) 5. under-appreciate 진가를 낮게 평가하다

As an AI language model assistant, your task is to help Korean students learning English to deeply understand English passages and to enable question creators to easily obtain quality fill-in-the-blank questions. When a user provides an English text, you will create a “fill-in-the-blank question” by leaving blanks in three important parts of the text and providing the answers along with brief explanations. The fill-in-the-blank questions and explanations should be provided in Korean.

[Guidelines]

1. Create Blanks: Create a total of three blanks labeled (A), (B), and (C) within the provided text.
2. The blanks should replace words or phrases that are crucial to the core content or require understanding the flow of the text to answer correctly.
3. Options for Each Blank:
  (1) Provide five options for each blank.
  (2) Each set of options should contain 1 or 2 correct answers.
  (3) Ensure that the correct answers for the blanks are different from the original text.
  (4) The distribution of correct answers should be random for each blank to prevent users from predicting them.
  (5) All options should be grammatically and stylistically correct when inserted into the blank.
  (6) The incorrect options (distractors) should be plausible and contextually relevant, challenging the student to think critically.
  (7) Ensure that the options are of a similar difficulty level.

4. Format:
  (1) The output should be similar in format to the provided example.
  (2) Clearly label the question and options, and separate the sections appropriately for readability.
  (3) All questions and explanations should be presented in Korean.
5. Answer and Explanations
  (1) Provide the correct answer(s) for each blank.
  (2) Include brief explanations in Korean that clarify why the correct answer is appropriate and, if necessary, why the distractors are incorrect.

[Example]

<<User's Input>>
Mental development consists of individuals increasingly mastering social codes and signals themselves, which they can master only in social situations with the support of more competent individuals, typically adults. In this sense, mental development consists of internalizing social patterns and gradually becoming a responsible actor among other responsible actors. In Denmark, the age of criminal responsibility is 15 years, which means that we then say that people have developed sufficient mental maturity to be accountable for their actions at this point. And at the age of 18 people are given the right to vote and are thereby formally included in the basic democratic process. I do not know whether these age boundaries are optimal, but it is clear that mental development takes place at different rates for different individuals, and depends especially on the social and family environment they have been given. Therefore, having formal limits for responsibility from a specific age that apply to everyone is a somewhat questionable practice. But the question, of course, is whether it can be done any differently.


<<Output>>
Mental development consists of individuals increasingly mastering social codes and signals themselves, which they can master only in social situations with the support of more competent individuals, typically adults. In this sense, mental development consists of (A)_______ social patterns and gradually becoming a responsible actor among other responsible actors. In Denmark, the age of criminal responsibility is 15 years, which means that we then say that people have developed sufficient mental (B)_______ to be accountable for their actions at this point. And at the age of 18 people are given the right to vote and are thereby formally included in the basic democratic process. I do not know whether these age boundaries are optimal, but it is clear that mental development takes place at different rates for different individuals, and depends especially on the social and family environment they have been given. Therefore, having formal limits for responsibility from a specific age that apply to everyone is a somewhat (C)_______ practice. But the question, of course, is whether it can be done any differently.

Q. 빈칸 (A), (B), (C) 에 들어갈 말로 가장 적절한 것은?
(A)
1. externalizing                2. assimilating
3. excluding                4. disowning
5. internalizing
(B)
1. ripeness                2. naivety
3. immaturity                4. childishness
5. underdevelopment

(C)
1. trustworthy                2. doubtful
3. uncertain                4. difinite
5. authentic

[Answer]
(A) 2. assimilating 동화하다, 받아들이다 / 5. internalizing 내재화하다
(B) 1. ripeness 성숙, 무르익음
(C) 2. doubtful 의심스러운 / uncertain 의심스러운, 불확실한

Although two weeks may not seem like a long time, I had the chance to make new friends, learn about a different culture, and, most importantly, do something that makes the lives of others better.
I am so glad that this family now has a safe place where they can lay their heads.
I believe everyone deserves a decent home.
Right now, there are still many people around the world without a place to live.
They are the reason why ordinary people like me want to go out there and help put a roof over their head.

Although two weeks may not seem like a long time, I had the (A)_______ to make new friends, learn about a different culture, and, most importantly, do something that makes the lives of others better.
I am so glad that this family now has a safe place where they can lay their heads.
I believe everyone deserves a (B)_______ home.
Right now, there are still many people around the world without a place to live.
They are the reason why (C)_______ people like me want to go out there and help put a roof over their head.

Q. 빈칸 (A), (B), (C) 에 들어갈 말로 가장 적절한 것은?

(A)
1. opportunity                2. assurance
3. guarantee                4. moment
5. inevitability

(B)
1. luxurious                2. temporary
3. inappropriate                4. unworthy
5. modest

(C)
1. exceptional                2. average
3. regular                        4. outstanding
5. remarkable


[Answer]
(A) 1. opportunity 기회 / 4. moment 순간, 때
(B) 5. modest 적당한, 괜찮은
(C) 2. average 평균적인 / 3. regular 보통의

As an AI language model assistant, your task is to help Korean students learning English to deeply understand English passages and to enable question creators to easily obtain quality fill-in-the-blank questions. When a user provides an English text, you will create a “fill-in-the-blank question” by leaving blanks in three important parts of the text and providing the answers along with brief explanations. The fill-in-the-blank questions and explanations should be provided in Korean.

[Guidelines]

1. Create Blanks: Create a total of three blanks labeled (A), (B), and (C) within the provided text.

3. Options for Each Blank:
  (1) Provide five options for each blank.
  (2) Each set of options should contain 1 or 2 correct answers.

  (4) The distribution of correct answers should be random for each blank to prevent users from predicting them.

  (6) The incorrect options (distractors) should be plausible and contextually relevant, challenging the student to think critically.

4. Format:

  (2) Clearly label the question and options, and separate the sections appropriately for readability.
  (3) All questions and explanations should be presented in Korean.
5. Answer and Explanations
  (1) Provide the correct answer(s) for each blank.
  (2) Include brief explanations in Korean that clarify why the correct answer is appropriate and, if necessary, why the distractors are incorrect.

[Example]

<<User's Input>>
Mental development consists of individuals increasingly mastering social codes and signals themselves, which they can master only in social situations with the support of more competent individuals, typically adults. In this sense, mental development consists of internalizing social patterns and gradually becoming a responsible actor among other responsible actors. In Denmark, the age of criminal responsibility is 15 years, which means that we then say that people have developed sufficient mental maturity to be accountable for their actions at this point. And at the age of 18 people are given the right to vote and are thereby formally included in the basic democratic process. I do not know whether these age boundaries are optimal, but it is clear that mental development takes place at different rates for different individuals, and depends especially on the social and family environment they have been given. Therefore, having formal limits for responsibility from a specific age that apply to everyone is a somewhat questionable practice. But the question, of course, is whether it can be done any differently.


<<Output>>
Mental development consists of individuals increasingly mastering social codes and signals themselves, which they can master only in social situations with the support of more competent individuals, typically adults. In this sense, mental development consists of (A)_______ social patterns and gradually becoming a responsible actor among other responsible actors. In Denmark, the age of criminal responsibility is 15 years, which means that we then say that people have developed sufficient mental (B)_______ to be accountable for their actions at this point. And at the age of 18 people are given the right to vote and are thereby formally included in the basic democratic process. I do not know whether these age boundaries are optimal, but it is clear that mental development takes place at different rates for different individuals, and depends especially on the social and family environment they have been given. Therefore, having formal limits for responsibility from a specific age that apply to everyone is a somewhat (C)_______ practice. But the question, of course, is whether it can be done any differently.

Q. 빈칸 (A), (B), (C) 에 들어갈 말로 가장 적절한 것은?
(A)
1. externalizing                2. assimilating
3. excluding                4. disowning
5. internalizing
(B)
1. ripeness                2. naivety
3. immaturity                4. childishness
5. underdevelopment

(C)
1. trustworthy                2. doubtful
3. uncertain                4. difinite
5. authentic

[Answer]
(A) 2. assimilating 동화하다, 받아들이다 / 5. internalizing 내재화하다
(B) 1. ripeness 성숙, 무르익음
(C) 2. doubtful 의심스러운 / uncertain 의심스러운, 불확실한

Any new or threatening situation may require us to make decisions and this requires information. So important is communication during a disaster that normal social barriers are often lowered. We will talk to strangers in a way we would never consider normally. Even relatively low grade disruption of our life such as a fire drill or a very late train seems to give us the permission to break normal etiquette and talk to strangers. The more important an event to a particular public, the more detailed and urgent the requirement for news becomes. Without an authoritative source of facts, whether that is a newspaper or trusted broadcast station, rumours often run riot. Rumours start because people believe their group to be in danger and so, although the rumour is unproven, feel they should pass it on. For example, if a worker heard that their employer’s business was doing badly and people were going to be made redundant, they would pass that information on to colleagues.

Any new or threatening situation may require us to make decisions and this requires information. So important is communication during a disaster that normal social barriers are often (A)_______. We will talk to strangers in a way we would never consider normally. Even relatively low grade disruption of our life such as a fire drill or a very late train seems to give us the (B)_______ to break normal etiquette and talk to strangers. The more important an event to a particular public, the more detailed and urgent the requirement for news becomes. Without an authoritative source of facts, whether that is a newspaper or trusted broadcast station, rumours often run (C)_______. Rumours start because people believe their group to be in danger and so, although the rumour is unproven, feel they should pass it on. For example, if a worker heard that their employer’s business was doing badly and people were going to be made redundant, they would pass that information on to colleagues.

Q. 빈칸 (A), (B), (C) 에 들어갈 말로 가장 적절한 것은?

(A)
1. strengthened                2. ignored 
3. reduced                4. reinforced
5. maintained

(B)
1. approval                2. excuse
3. prohibition                 4. denial
5. grant

(C)
1. control                 2. chaos
3. order                        4. disturbance 
5. understated


[Answer]
(A) 3. reduced 낮추다 / 감소하다
(B) 1. approval 허가, 승인 / 5. grant 허가, 수여
(C) 2. chaos 혼란, 무질서 / 4. disturbance 어지러운 것, 방해

When a user provides an English text, you will create a “fill-in-the-blank question” by leaving blanks in three important parts of the text and providing the answers along with brief explanations.   (7) Ensure that the options are of a similar difficulty level.

  (3) All questions and explanations should be presented in Korean.
5. Answer and Explanations

In Denmark, the age of criminal responsibility is 15 years, which means that we then say that people have developed sufficient mental maturity to be accountable for their actions at this point. And at the age of 18 people are given the right to vote and are thereby formally included in the basic democratic process. I do not know whether these age boundaries are optimal, but it is clear that mental development takes place at different rates for different individuals, and depends especially on the social and family environment they have been given. Therefore, having formal limits for responsibility from a specific age that apply to everyone is a somewhat questionable practice. But the question, of course, is whether it can be done any differently.


<<Output>>
Mental development consists of individuals increasingly mastering social codes and signals themselves, which they can master only in social situations with the support of more competent individuals, typically adults. In this sense, mental development consists of (A)_______ social patterns and gradually becoming a responsible actor among other responsible actors. In Denmark, the age of criminal responsibility is 15 years, which means that we then say that people have developed sufficient mental (B)_______ to be accountable for their actions at this point. I do not know whether these age boundaries are optimal, but it is clear that mental development takes place at different rates for different individuals, and depends especially on the social and family environment they have been given. But the question, of course, is whether it can be done any differently.

(A)
1. externalizing                2. assimilating
3. excluding                4. disowning
5. internalizing
(B)
1. ripeness                2. naivety
3. immaturity                4. childishness
5. underdevelopment

(C)
1. trustworthy                2. doubtful
3. uncertain                4. difinite
5. authentic

[Answer]
(A) 2. assimilating 동화하다, 받아들이다 / 5. internalizing 내재화하다
(B) 1. ripeness 성숙, 무르익음
(C) 2. doubtful 의심스러운 / uncertain 의심스러운, 불확실한

In today’s information age, in many companies and on many teams, the objective is no longer error prevention and replicability. On the contrary, it’s creativity, speed, and keenness. In the industrial era, the goal was to minimize variation. But in creative companies today, maximizing variation is more essential. In these situations, the biggest risk isn’t making a mistake or losing consistency; it’s failing to attract top talent, to invent new products, or to change direction quickly when the environment shifts. Consistency and repeatability are more likely to suppress fresh thinking than to bring your company profit. A lot of little mistakes, while sometimes painful, help the organization learn quickly and are a critical part of the innovation cycle. In these situations, rules and process are no longer the best answer. A symphony isn’t what you’re going for. Leave the conductor and the sheet music behind. Build a jazz band instead.

In today’s information age, in many companies and on many teams, the objective is no longer error prevention and replicability. On the contrary, it’s creativity, speed, and keenness. In the industrial era, the goal was to minimize variation. But in creative companies today, (A)_______ variation is more essential. In these situations, the biggest risk isn’t making a mistake or losing consistency; it’s failing to attract top talent, to invent new products, or to change direction quickly when the environment shifts. Consistency and repeatability are more likely to (B)_______ fresh thinking than to bring your company profit. A lot of little mistakes, while sometimes painful, help the organization learn quickly and are a critical part of the innovation cycle. In these situations, rules and process are (C)_______ the best answer. A symphony isn’t what you’re going for. Leave the conductor and the sheet music behind. Build a jazz band instead.

Q. 빈칸 (A), (B), (C) 에 들어갈 말로 가장 적절한 것은?

(A)
1. minimizing                2. shrinking
3. diminishing                4. amplifying
5. elevating

(B)
1. restrain                2. inhibit
3. promote                4. liberate
5. release

(C)
1. still                        2. no further
3. currently                4. not anymore
5. persisting


[Answer]
(A) 4. amplifying 확대하는 / 5. elevating 고양하는
(B) 1. restrain 억제하다 / 2. inhibit 억제하다
(C) 2. no further 더 이상 ~아닌 / 4. not anymore 더 이상 ~하지 않다

When artists add their own creative touches, things that most people consider junk are reborn as beautiful works of art. 
The giant pictures made from trash by environmental artist Tom Deininger are one of a kind. 
Up close, these brightly colored creations look like a mixed-up mess of broken plastic, unwanted toys, and bent wire—all things that cannot be recycled. 
From farther away, however, they appear to blend together into marvelous landscapes or other paintings. 
There is also an artist who shows that even disposable cups can be reused as artistic material. 
For years, Gwyneth Leech has turned used coffee cups into brilliant art exhibits. 
After a cup is used by someone, she paints a unique design on it and hangs it with many other painted cups in front of a window or pretty background. 
These works from Leech and Deininger are not only pleasing to the eye, but they also naturally provoke an interest in environmental conservation in people.

When artists add their own creative touches, things that most people consider junk are reborn as beautiful works of art. 
The giant pictures made from trash by environmental artist Tom Deininger are one of a kind. 
Up close, these brightly colored creations look like a mixed-up mess of broken plastic, unwanted toys, and bent wire—all things that cannot be recycled. 
From farther away, however, they appear to (A)_______ into marvelous landscapes or other paintings. 
There is also an artist who shows that even (B)_______ cups can be reused as artistic material. 
For years, Gwyneth Leech has turned used coffee cups into brilliant art exhibits. 
After a cup is used by someone, she paints a unique design on it and hangs it with many other painted cups in front of a window or pretty background. 
These works from Leech and Deininger are not only pleasing to the eye, but they also naturally (C)_______ an interest in environmental conservation in people.

Q. 빈칸 (A), (B), (C) 에 들어갈 말로 가장 적절한 것은?

(A)
1. isolate                        2. segregate
3. divide                        4. blend together
5. split

(B)
1. reusable                2. glass
3. disposable                4. ceramic
5. fragile

(C)
1. decrease                2. evoke
3. obscure                4. divert
5. provoke


[Answer]
(A) 4. blend together 한데 섞다, 어울리다
(B) 3. disposable 일회용의
(C) 2. provoke 유발하다
